definition: state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131
strategic experts as thick as rain (idiom); no shortage of advisers on strategy

sentences.english: He knew this was a famous adviser to the king, so he decided to follow his words.
sentences.chinese: 他知道这个谋臣深得国王宠信，因此决定试一试。

sentences.english: So he went and told this story to his friend, an adviser to the king.
sentences.chinese: 于是就去把这件事说给国王的一个谋臣，他的朋友听。

sentences.english: So he decided to give him a gift of 100,000 gold coins.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他决定将十万金币作为礼物送给那位谋臣。

sentences.english: The king appointed him to the adviser's position.
sentences.chinese: 国王任命他接替谋臣的职位。

definition: Xun Yu (163-212), brilliant strategist, advisor of Cao Cao in Three Kingdoms
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
Xiao He (-193 BC), famous strategist and chancellor, fought on Liu Bang's 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] side during the Chu-Han Contention 楚漢戰爭|楚汉战争[Chu3 Han4 Zhan4 zheng1]
Cheng Yu (141-220), advisor to General Cao Cao 曹操 during the Three Kingdoms era
Lu Su or Lu Zijing 魯子敬|鲁子敬 (172-217), statesman, diplomat and strategist of Eastern Wu 東吳|东吴

Cao Can (-190 BC), second chancellor of Han Dynasty, contributed to its founding by fighting on Liu Bang's 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] side during the Chu-Han Contention 楚漢戰爭|楚汉战争[Chu3 Han4 Zhan4 zheng1]/also pr. [Cao2 Shen1]
